value.title: Yet another 10 Deep Learning projects based on Apache MXNet

content.subtitle: In previous articles, I listed 10 Deep Learning projects based on Apache MXNet…. and then 10 more… and what do you know, here is another…

paragraphs.name: 5d94
paragraphs.text: Yet another 10 Deep Learning projects based on Apache MXNet

paragraphs.name: 6afd
paragraphs.text: In previous articles, I listed 10 Deep Learning projects based on Apache MXNet…. and then 10 more… and what do you know, here is another batch!

paragraphs.name: bdd0
paragraphs.text: Oh, we’ll get there… eventually.

paragraphs.name: fa2b
paragraphs.text: Models

paragraphs.name: f30b
paragraphs.text: #1 — Dual Path Networks
This is an implementation of the architecture described on the self-titled paper by Yunpeng Chen, Jianan Li, Huaxin Xiao, Xiaojie Jin, Shuicheng Yan and Jiashi Feng.

paragraphs.name: bfb6
paragraphs.text: This architecture won the ImageNet 2017 object localization competition with a top-5 error of 6.22%.

paragraphs.name: 03be
paragraphs.text: Quoting from the paper: “On the ImageNet-1k dataset, a shallow DPN surpasses the best ResNeXt-101(64x4d) with 26% smaller model size, 25% less computational cost and 8% lower memory consumption, and a deeper DPN (DPN-131) further pushes the state-of-the-art single model performance with about 2 times faster training speed”.

paragraphs.name: 4e16
paragraphs.text:
cypw/DPNs
DPNs - Dual Path Networksgithub.com

paragraphs.name: 89d9
paragraphs.text: #2— Squeeze-and-Excitation Networks
This is an implementation of the architecture described on the self-titled paper by Jie Hu, Li Shen and Gang Sun.

paragraphs.name: 096d
paragraphs.text: This architecture won the ImageNet 2017 classification competition with a top-5 error of 2.251%.

paragraphs.name: 1b98
paragraphs.text:
bruinxiong/SENet.mxnet
SENet.mxnet — :fire::fire: A MXNet implementation of Squeeze-and-Excitation Networks (SE-ResNext, SE-Resnet…github.com

paragraphs.name: ff53
paragraphs.text: #3 — Capsule Networks (Symbolic API)

paragraphs.name: 369f
paragraphs.text: This project implements the CapsNet architecture presented in the “Dynamic Routing Between Capsules” paper by Sara Sabour, Nicholas Frosst, and Geoffrey E Hinton. In a nutshell, capsule networks are an exciting new development designed to overcome the limitations of convolutional neural networks.

paragraphs.name: fc27
paragraphs.text:
Soonhwan-Kwon/capsnet.mxnet
capsnet.mxnet - MXNet implementation of CapsNetgithub.com

paragraphs.name: 432d
paragraphs.text: This code achieves 99.71% accuracy on the MNIST dataset, which is in line with the scores reported in the paper.

paragraphs.name: fdef
paragraphs.text: #4 — Capsule Networks (Gluon API)

paragraphs.name: adf6
paragraphs.text: This project also implements the CapsNet architecture, but it does so using the imperative Gluon API (here’s an introduction to Gluon if you’re not familiar with it).

paragraphs.name: c145
paragraphs.text:
GarrickLin/Capsnet.Gluon
Capsnet.Gluon - Capsule Net implementation in Gluongithub.com

paragraphs.name: a0e2
paragraphs.text: This implementation achieves 99.53% accuracy on MNIST, which the author suggests could be improved by adding more data augmentation.

paragraphs.name: 99ab
paragraphs.text: #5 — MobileNets

This is an implementation of the architecture described in “MobileNets: Efficient Convolutional Neural Networks for Mobile Vision Applications” by Andrew G. Howard, Menglong Zhu, Bo Chen, Dmitry Kalenichenko, Weijun Wang, Tobias Weyand, Marco Andreetto and Hartwig Adam.

paragraphs.name: f08a
paragraphs.text: Quoting from the paper: MobileNets are “a class of efficient models (…) for mobile and embedded vision applications. MobileNets are based on a streamlined architecture that uses depth-wise separable convolutions to build light weight deep neural networks”.

paragraphs.name: 05f4
paragraphs.text: A model pre-trained on ImageNet is provided, with a top-5 accuracy of 90.15%.

paragraphs.name: 368a
paragraphs.text:
KeyKy/mobilenet-mxnet
mobilenet-mxnetgithub.com

paragraphs.name: f225
paragraphs.text: Applications

paragraphs.name: bece
paragraphs.text: #6— Face Recognition

paragraphs.name: bd47
paragraphs.text: This is an implementation of the architecture described in “ArcFace: Additive Angular Margin Loss for Deep Face Recognition” by Jiankang Deng, Jia Guo, and Stefanos Zafeiriou.
InsightFace is a new face recognition method, which achieves state-of-the art scores of 99.80%+ on LFW and 98%+ on Megaface.

paragraphs.name: cd9e
paragraphs.text:
deepinsight/insightface
insightface - Face Recognition Project on MXNetgithub.com
#7 — Speech to Text

paragraphs.name: 35db
paragraphs.text: This is an implementation of the architecture described in “Deep Speech 2: End-to-End Speech Recognition in English and Mandarin” by Dario Amodei, Rishita Anubhai, Eric Battenberg, Carl Case, Jared Casper, Bryan Catanzaro, Jingdong Chen, Mike Chrzanowski, Adam Coates, Greg Diamos, Erich Elsen, Jesse Engel, Linxi Fan, Christopher Fougner, Tony Han, Awni Hannun, Billy Jun, Patrick LeGresley, Libby Lin, Sharan Narang, Andrew Ng, Sherjil Ozair, Ryan Prenger, Jonathan Raiman, Sanjeev Satheesh, David Seetapun, Shubho Sengupta, Yi Wang, Zhiqian Wang, Chong Wang, Bo Xiao, Dani Yogatama, Jun Zhan and Zhenyao Zhu (pfew!).

paragraphs.name: ac10
paragraphs.text: This is a great project if you want to build a speech-to-text model. Please bear in mind that you will need a very large dataset. Quoting from the original paper: “our English speech system is trained on 11,940 hours of speech, while the Mandarin system is trained on 9,400 hours. We use data synthesis to further augment the data during training”.

paragraphs.name: a6da
paragraphs.text:
samsungsds-rnd/deepspeech.mxnet
deepspeech.mxnet - A MXNet implementation of Baidu's DeepSpeech architecturegithub.com
#8— 3D face reconstruction

paragraphs.name: b312
paragraphs.text: This is an implementation of the architecture described in “End-to-end 3D face reconstruction with deep neural networks” by Pengfei Dou, Shishir K. Shah and Ioannis A. Kakadiaris.
Thanks to this project, you can build a 3D model of a a face using only a single 2D image. Quite impressive!

paragraphs.name: f6c2
paragraphs.text:
ShownX/mxnet-E2FAR
mxnet-E2FAR - MXNET/Gluon Implementation of End-to-end 3D Face Reconstruction with Deep Neural Networksgithub.com

paragraphs.name: aabc
paragraphs.text: Examples taken from the original paper
Tools

paragraphs.name: a453
paragraphs.text: #9 — Deepo

paragraphs.name: 6e4b
paragraphs.text: Deepo is a set of pre-built containers for Deep Learning. It supports MXNet as well as other frameworks. Containers will run on Linux (CPU/GPU), Windows (CPU) and MacOS (CPU) with either Python 2.7 or Python 3.6.

paragraphs.name: 9a86
paragraphs.text:
ufoym/deepo
deepo - A series of Docker images (and their generator) that allows you to quickly set up your deep learning research…github.com

paragraphs.name: 01df
paragraphs.text: This is pretty handy if you want to work locally, and of course on AWS with one of our Docker services: ECS, EKS or Fargate.

paragraphs.name: 166e
paragraphs.text: #10 — MXNet finetuner

paragraphs.name: d5e9
paragraphs.text: This tool simplifies the process of fine-tuning an image classification dataset on your own dataset (here’s an introduction to fine-tuning if you’re unfamiliar with this technique).

It wil automatically build RecordIO files from a tree of images, download pre-trained models, replace the last layer according to the number of classes in your dataset, add data augmentation, run fine-tuning, visualize results, etc.
Good stuff!

paragraphs.name: c454
paragraphs.text:
knjcode/mxnet-finetuner
mxnet-finetuner - An all-in-one Deep Learning toolkit for image classification to fine-tuning pretrained models using…github.com

paragraphs.name: 9e9d
paragraphs.text: That’s it for today. Kudos to all project authors for their fascinating work. I hope they will inspire you to get started with Deep Learning.

paragraphs.name: f0dc
paragraphs.text: As always, thanks a lot for reading!

paragraphs.name: c47c
paragraphs.text: One of the most addictive albums I’ve heard in years. Listen once, sing it forever \m/
